    • Field Detail

      • searchView

        android.widget.SearchView searchView
        To search photos and show them

      • cardView

        android.support.v7.widget.CardView cardView
        To show No results message if there NO results after search

      • searchListener

        private final android.widget.SearchView.OnQueryTextListener searchListener
        The listener of interaction with searchView, when press enter we apply searching and call applySearch method.

      • reLoadListener

        protected final ThumbPhotoDataSource.OnThumbPhotoArrivedListener reLoadListener
        Listener as field of anonymous inner class, that hold the behavior of the fragment after we reload all the thumb photos of the fragment. In this listener firstly we clear the content of list then add the photos to the list and the recycler view and then we refresh the content. Behave exactly like super (and other fragments), just in the end check if there NO results found, if there NO results found show appropriate message.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SearchFragment

        public SearchFragment()
        Default constructor, must call super

    • Method Detail

      • loadPhotosOnCreate

        protected void loadPhotosOnCreate()
        Load photos form the internet when create the fragment, every fragment provide his own implementation, and determine to load or NOT to load photos from internet. In Search fragment we will NOT load photos, because we do search, and wait to user input.
        Specified by:
        loadPhotosOnCreate in class AbstractThumbListFragment

      • addNextPhotos

        public void addNextPhotos()
        When reach the bottom of the list (the end of the list), request the next thumb photos from the website. And add them to the recycler view.

      • reLoadPhotos

        public void reLoadPhotos()
        Just reload all the content to the list and to the recycler view.

      • onCreateView

        public android.view.View onCreateView(android.view.LayoutInflater inflater,
                                      android.view.ViewGroup container,
                                      android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Create the view and setup the UI
        Specified by:
        onCreateView in class AbstractThumbListFragment
        Parameters:
        inflater - The LayoutInflater object that can be used to inflate any views in the fragment,
        container - If non-null, this is the parent view that the fragment's UI should be attached to. The fragment should not add the view itself, but this can be used to generate the LayoutParams of the view.
        savedInstanceState - If non-null, this fragment is being re-constructed from a previous saved state as given here.
        Returns:
        Return the View for the fragment's UI, or null.

      • showNoResultsCardIfNeeded

        private void showNoResultsCardIfNeeded()
        Show the message "No Results found", if there no results found, after applying search. Or applying search and moved to another fragment.

      • hideNoResultsCardIfNeeded

        private void hideNoResultsCardIfNeeded()
        Hide the message "No Results found" after clear the searched text, to apply new search or just to clear the old search and to clear the message "No results found".

      • hideNoResultsCard

        private void hideNoResultsCard()
        Force hiding "No Results found", use it after press search button

      • onResume

        public void onResume()
        Description copied from class: android.support.v4.app.Fragment
        Called when the fragment is visible to the user and actively running. This is generally tied to Activity.onResume of the containing Activity's lifecycle.
        Overrides:
        onResume in class AbstractThumbListFragment

      • newInstance

        public static SearchFragment newInstance()
        Refactoring method to create new instance of the SearchFragment.
        Returns:
        a new instance of SearchFragment.

      • hideKeyboard

        private void hideKeyboard()
        Method to hide the keyboard after pressing search (enter button)

      • applySearch

        private void applySearch()
        Here we apply the searching, and get the results from the website, and show them to user. Firstly clear the old results, load searched photos from the website, while show the loading bar, and hide keyboard. And when the results show up, we show them to user, and hide the loading bar (in the listener).
